New Records: Fakhar Zaman smashed Pakistan’s fastest-ever ton in a World Cup
Key Match Events: Rachin Ravindra (108) smashed his third century in the tournament
Kane Williamson (95) missed out on a hundred on his return
Ben Stokes provided the resistance with 64 off 90 balls
Post-Match Reflections: Zaman said, “This is one of my best (centuries),” after smashing Pakistan’s fastest-ever ton in a World Cup
Captain Babar Azam said, “We just planned to build a partnership. I wanted to give the strike to Fakhar,”
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan moved level on eight points with New Zealand, which occupies fourth place in the standings by virtue of a better net run-rate than Pakistan and Afghanistan
Pakistan, which also lost four games in a row at one stage, can still get into the semifinals, with its last league game against England on Nov. 11
